result.execSummary:
The defendant Emery L. Walker Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Emery L. Walker Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Emery L. Walker Jr. was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with known felons or drug dealers or gang members, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain a stable residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emery L. Walker Jr.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Defendant is sentenced to 8 years years in the WSP forthwith and concurrent to any other sentence; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Atty DeFilippis to determine amount of sentence credit and will submit a letter to the court for approval.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 10/23/15 at 10:00 AM.
Final pre-trial at 09-02-2015 09:10 am
